entries.meaning: (figuratively, humorous) comparative form of dead: more dead; or at least more evidently dead.
examples: He was deader than a dead dog's bone buried down a blind alley off a dead-end street in a ghost town. Man, he was dead.

entries.meaning: (informal, chiefly humorous) One who is deceased, or will shortly become so.
examples: I could tell he was a deader by the way his eyes were glazed over; there was no life left in those eyes.
